content.html:
Warm Up Activity

Here is a graph of a function \(f(x)=400 \cdot (0.2)^x\).

  1. Identify the approximate graphing window shown.

Write down your answer. Then select the Solution button to check your work.

Compare your answer:

\(0<x<44\) and \(0<y<1,100\) or equivalent



  1. Suggest a new graphing window that would:
    1. make the graph more informative or meaningful.

Write down your answer. Then select the Solution button to check your work.

Compare your answer:

\( 0<x<10\) and \(0<y<450\). This window would include \(x\)-values where meaningful changes happen and exclude the parts where the changes are very small. The \(y\)-values are limited to values that matter, between 0 and 400, allowing us to see more clearly the changes in that range.



    1. make the graph less informative or meaningful.

Write down your answer. Then select the Solution button to check your work.

Compare your answer:

\(-10<x<80\) and \(10<y<700\). This window would show a lot of useless \(x\)-values and cut off the \(y\)-values at 100, which would hide the behavior of the function when \(x\) is between 0 and 1.
